A shotgun is a [firearm](/wiki/Firearm "Firearm") introduced in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"). It features high accuracy and damage, but low range and uncommon ammunition.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Description](#Description)
  - [2.1 Rate of fire](#Rate_of_fire)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 Origin](#Origin)

## Generation

SLASH'EM shopkeepers are guaranteed to have a shotgun. They do not generate otherwise.

## Description

Shotguns are one-handed, and typically fire one shot a time. A Skilled or Expert character with a highly enchanted shotgun has a chance of firing two or three shots.

Shotguns are very accurate, with a +3 to-hit bonus, and they also fire [shotgun shells](/wiki/Shotgun_shell "Shotgun shell") which do more damage than ordinary [bullets](/wiki/Bullet "Bullet"), but they have a very limited range at 3 squares. Furthermore, the ammunition is uncommon: it can only be found on shopkeepers and 50% of [captains](/wiki/Captain "Captain") and [sergeants](/wiki/Sergeant "Sergeant"), compared to bullets which can be found on most [Yendorian Army](/wiki/Yendorian_Army "Yendorian Army") members.

### Rate of fire

| Enchantment | Unskilled/basic | Skilled       | Expert        |
| ----------- | --------------- | ------------- | ------------- |
| +2 or lower | 1               | 1             | 1             |
| +3 to +5    | 1               | 1             | 1d4-2 (min 1) |
| +6 to +8    | 1               | 1d4-2 (min 1) | 1d5-2 (min 1) |
| +9          | 1d4-2 (min 1)   | 1d5-2 (min 1) | 1d6-2 (min 1) |

## Strategy

Shotguns can theoretically make powerful early-game weapons with their high damage and accuracy bonus, but a player capable of killing a shopkeeper almost certainly doesn't need one. Later on, their low rate of fire, low range, and rare ammunition make them impractical to use.

In the hands of a shopkeeper, a shotgun is deadly to new characters, since unlike the [wand of striking](/wiki/Wand_of_striking "Wand of striking") that shopkeepers have in vanilla Nethack it cannot be countered by magic resistance. Shopkeepers' shotguns have the ordinary chance to be [cursed](/wiki/Cursed "Cursed"): this will reduce their melee damage to *1d2* per attack, rendering them considerably less of a threat in melee. However, an early character will still likely die unless they have some kind of [escape item](/wiki/Escape_item "Escape item"), as they will be unable to outrun the shopkeeper or meaningfully hit them back.

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Shotgun](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Search/Shotgun "wikipedia:Special:Search/Shotgun")***

Shotguns are ordinarily smoothbore (non-rifled) weapons that fire a large shell, rather than a small bullet. Usually, this shell is filled with small pellets (called *shot*), which disperse in an area around their target, rather than hitting a single point. This makes them useful for hitting small, fast-moving targets, since one does not need a direct hit - this is represented in SLASH'EM by their +3 accuracy bonus.

While real-life shotguns do indeed have less range than other firearms, it is not as exaggerated as it is in SLASH'EM. Typical shotgun shells are effective to around 35 meters - while the distance covered by a square in Nethack is somewhat ambiguous, by even the most conservative measure 35 meters should translate to at least 10 or 11 squares.
